At-a-Glance: Good sites balance forage access, sun, wind protection, drainage, and neighbour relations.
Why it Matters: Location influences colony health, winter survival, and apiary safety.
Step-by-Step: Assess wind/sun exposure; ensure year-round water; provide firm, level stands; orient entrances away from paths; plan vehicle access and biosecurity.
Seasonality & Climate: High ground drains well in wet winters; shade helps in heat waves; hedge lines act as flight barriers near boundaries.
Common Pitfalls: Flood-prone low spots, cramped access for supers, and entrances facing public footpaths.
Tools & Materials: Stands, straps, water supply, fencing/hedging, and signage where appropriate.
